request_pathways.name: Authorization for Release of Protected Health Information (.docx)
Mail to PO Box 151, Albion, NE 68620
In-person delivery at 1173 South 8th Street, Albion, NE

forms.document_type: HIPAA contact designation form (not an ROI form)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a generic HIPAA authorization .docx form, prints and handwrites fields, then submits via fax, mail, email, or in person.

red_flags: Form published only as .docx file, creating accessibility barrier for patients without Microsoft Word
Superseded 2017 form still accessible at original URL with outdated address, risking patient confusion
bright_spots: Dedicated ROI email address (Roi@boonecohealth.org) suggests staffed intake process
Encrypted email offered as a delivery format option — uncommon for critical access hospitals
Separate initials required for substance abuse, mental health, and HIV/AIDS per Nebraska law
Concise, plain-language legal acknowledgments with clear non-coercion statement

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — form listed on Patient Forms page and discoverable via web search, though .docx format and stale indexed older version create minor friction.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds and fax submission available — form can be downloaded and printed but has zero fillable fields; .docx format is unusual; fax and potentially email provide electronic submission paths.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but has notable problems — logical structure and plain language, but release direction framing is confusing for patient self-requests, no submission instructions provided, garbled sensitive-info text, and vague fee disclosure.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — generic HIPAA authorization with 'Patient Request' checkbox but no acknowledgment of patient access rights, confusing FROM/TO directionality for self-requests, and no turnaround time or rights statement.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing that would materially impede a patient — proper non-coercion statement, revocation rights, 12-month expiration; fee language is vague but references state law; photo ID scope is ambiguous but not clearly excessive.

overall.summary: Boone County Health Center provides a findable, functional generic ROI form with some bright spots (dedicated email, encrypted delivery) but lacks fillable fields, patient access differentiation, and digital-first design.
